meanings.sent1: She is a talky person who enjoys chatting with everyone.
meanings.sent2: The talky parrot wouldn't stop chattering all day.
meanings.sent3: The talky squirrel in the park entertained the visitors with its constant babble.
meanings.sent4: Her talky nature was like a never-ending stream of words flowing out.
meanings.sent5: The talky child at the party kept everyone engaged with endless stories.

meanings.sent1: The talky professor went on and on about his research.
meanings.sent2: Her talky behavior during the meeting annoyed her colleagues.
meanings.sent3: The talky cat meowed non-stop until it got some attention.
meanings.sent4: The talky radio host's voice filled the airwaves with constant chatter.
meanings.sent5: The talky politician's speech seemed to have no end, much to the audience's dismay.

meanings.definition: Using a lot of words or dialogue
meanings.sent1: The talky book had pages filled with endless conversations.
meanings.sent2: The talky script for the play required the actors to memorize many lines.
meanings.sent3: The talky movie had so much dialogue that it felt like a never-ending talk show.
meanings.sent4: Her talky writing style made the novel a lengthy read.
meanings.sent5: The talky presentation at work seemed to drag on with unnecessary details.
